annotated_bib.problem_stmt: In Boston today an outdated public transporation system known as the MBTA is using older train cars to hold its passengers. The space in these cars fill up quickly and eventually there is no where for these people to go.
annotated_bib.citation: Grabar, H. (2016, February 12).Subway Cars Should Be Like Centipedes Retrieved July 11, 2016,from http://www.slate.com/articles/business/metropolis/2016/02/subways_should_have_open_gangway_cars_why_does_the_u_s_resist_it.html

annotation.background: This article by the Slate, a popular magazine that examines and analyzes issues in today's society,
annotation.summary: takes a look at space situation with subway systems in America. The article first examines why subway cars are becoming so overcrowded in these American cities. Afterwards it looks at the solutions other cities like Paris, Tokyo and Toronto have done to fix this issue.
annotation.relevance: What the author finds to be the best solution to improving the space in these subway cars is having gangway trains instead of the string of separate cars that attach to one and another.

annotated_bib.citation: Annear, S.(2013, October 22). MBTA Orange Line Trains Will Be Replaced, Red Line Vehicles Added. Retrieved July 11, 2016,from http://www.bostonmagazine.com/news/blog/2013/10/22/mbta-ornage-line-trains-upgrades-red-line-governor-patrick/

annotation.background: The article, written by Steve Annear a digital writer at Boston Magazine graduate from Roger Williams University former writer at Boston Metro newspaper,
annotation.summary: discusses the newly passed bill that will improve the MBTA system. The article discusses how both the Orange and Red line will both have new sets of vehicles that will provide more seating and space for riders. The planned timetable for these improvements are to be avaliable by 2019.
annotation.relevance: For people already using the subway and train systems these new additions to the Orange and Red line will provide them a more comfortable riding experience. These new improvements may also lead to more timely and accurate scheduling that will lead to less delays and faster commutes.

annotated_bib.citation: Gans, F.(2015, December 22). MBTA Riders Demand Improvements in Service amid Fare Hike Plan.The Boston Globe (Boston, MA). Retrieved July 12, 2016, from https://www.bostonglobe.com/metro/2015/12/22/next-stop-resistance-prospect-higher-fares/2MSl8eUccvmczziTtY9haP/story.html

annotation.background: This article from the Boston Globe, one of the most well known newspaper companies in the country,
annotation.summary: takes a look into the new fare hikes by the MBTA and overall reception by their customers. First the article goes into the 10 percent hike increase and the frequency at which these prices are going up at. When interviewing some of the riders of the MBTA, the reception was seen be as negative, as one rider put it "It’s not a big amount, but think ahead. If every 24 months they keep on raising it, one day, it’s going to be $40 a week. And then one day, it’s going to be $50 a week. I don’t know why they can’t just keep it a normal fare”. Later the article goes on to examine the demand by the customers for improved services, but also acknowledges that people are skeptical of these upcoming improvements.
annotation.relevance: It seems as if the author was able to find the sway of the public was moving towards in the sense of the situation.

annotated_bib.citation: McDonald, C.(2016, June 28). Meet The Germs Sharing Your Seat On The Subway.Retrieved July 12, 2016, from http://www.popsci.com/subway-bugs-boston

annotation.background: Popular Science, a long running, prestigious magazine that finds all of the new and most revelant topics in the science community,
annotation.summary: =takes a look at the microbes and germs that can be found all over the inside of a subway car. First the author goes through previous studies done by researches in cities like San Francisco and New York took samples from subway cars and were able to find a plethora of germs and microbes that exist within these areas. The articles goes on to talk about how recently in Boston research team went to examine some of these subway cars and collect and analysis the samples they acquired. From there it divulges into more of a research and science background examining the results and what actually exists in these areas.
annotation.relevance: The article brings more awareness to idea that public transporation can be a simple way of contracting these germs and bugs from other individuals. What can be done is for these systems to implement improvements that will provide less opportunity for these germs to spread and grow.
